meanings.definition: To find fault or complain constantly
meanings.sent1: She was always carping about the weather, no matter how sunny it was.
meanings.sent2: He tends to carping about the smallest details, making it hard to enjoy the moment.
meanings.sent3: The carping of the grumpy old man about the new technology was quite amusing to the young crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her carping echoed through the room, drowning out any positive comments.
meanings.sent5: The carping of the toddler about the vegetables was so persistent that eventually, he got a cookie instead.

meanings.sent1: Ignoring the carping of her classmates, she focused on her artwork with determination.
meanings.sent2: The constant carping from the critics only fueled his determination to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The carping from the peanut gallery was like background noise to the main event.
meanings.sent4: His carping was like a broken record, repeating the same complaints over and over.
meanings.sent5: The carping of the gossiping neighbors could be heard through the thin walls of the apartment building.
